messages.message: Do we do any GPU training for model development? Nvidia wants to know if any engineers want to meet with their solution engineers and free resources

I think this is something that we are just beginning to think about, typically I think we would use GClouds GPUs to do this - for instance, for checkbox training. Only other person that would probably have comments on this would be Ted :grimacing: TLDR I think eventually but at this very moment we don’t do much of that. but we probably will in the future
yeah I can definitely see us doing more of this in the future. I think we are always interested in “free resources” though @Matt :wink:
Oh yes certainly :slightly_smiling_face: even right now @Ahsaas has been doing some work that would rely on this sort of resource
For sure, such resources with def. speed up experimentations
I’m not sure what we could tell their engineers tho - if their resources are on the cloud, we are limited to using public datasets, which we currently need to do more around
i’ve used GPUs for training in the past @Matt (the checkbox stuff), but not a current focus for anyone i think.
Maybe a good next step is to get some async information from them on what they offer and then we can go from their, see if it makes sense
They more looking to give guidance on using GPU’s give help where they can based on questions we may have, frameworks they recommend.
They are looking to have someone from their team meet with someone from our team
aw so no free gpus? xD
Hmmm i’d be worried that we don’t have the right questions yet, unless @Chetan you may have some ideas?

I actually don’t think GPU usage advice and guidance is what we need, I think a lot of our issues just stem around having data and where we can use that data to train, which I am not sure if they would actually be able to answer those questions haha
Maybe that can be something we can ask if we want to engage, what have they seen re GPU usage for customers that want to do ML with very little data or lack of public data
Anyhow, I’ll leave that decision to an eng lead, @Kerry @lydia , I would think we’d want to circle back in a few months instead
yea i don’t think they’d have modeling advice really. in terms of “where to train”, also an us decision but EC2 is where ted/loc/i did stuff.
so i guess succinct answer is probably no. albeit if the offer changes to free gpus :troll:

Its more about them teaching us best practices etc. Who would like to spend time like 30-60mins with one of their engineers who can walk you through this space epecially for computer vision esque things like is the box checked

yea plenty of us have backgrounds there already and the main obstacles are really the data / problem context / how to model with tiny sample sizes vs implementation/technology/speed (where they could be helpful). glad they reached out though :slightly_smiling_face:
